comments.body: This change is also not necessary for normal use, but it would still be useful if someone added multiple entries to managedFields that had no timestamp or the same timestamp and the same manager name
Do we have a test for the sorting of this? or this function in general?
Yes, we do, and this change didn't require any change to that test
Should Manager field be compared in this case ?
that's a good point, actually they should be compared if they are both nil.

Or rather:
we're only going to see that if operations are the same, which means that they are both update or  both apply. If they are both apply, we should expect both to be nil, and we want to compare by manager. If they are update then we should expect neither to be nil, and compare first by time and then by manager.
I thought I saw a test testing that, but I must have been wrong ... We need to have a test for that.
Maybe change the check of Time against nil to assertion since you don't expect it to be nil.

We already got an assertion for nil managers here: https://github.com/kwiesmueller/kubernetes/blob/4394bf779800710e67beae9bddde4bb5425ce039/staging/src/k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/endpoints/handlers/fieldmanager/fieldmanager.go#L249 before this gets called. But yes could put one here as well.

And we do expect time to be nil on Apply operations.
